shead.#text:
This section shows the corporate Targets, which are set and cascaded by the Board of Management.
<br />
<br />
These targets are applicable for all Senior and Executive Managers (SG 12+), according to the ASML Senior and Executive Management Performance related Variable Pay plan (for more information go to the <a href="http://collaboration.asml.com/teams/gm-senior-management/SitePages/Home.aspx" target="_blank">ASML Senior Management Intranet page</a>)
shead.@description:
This section shows the corporate Targets, which are set and cascaded by the Board of Management.
<br />
<br />
These targets are applicable for all Senior and Executive Managers (SG 12+), according to the ASML Senior and Executive Management Performance related Variable Pay plan (for more information go to the <a href="http://collaboration.asml.com/teams/gm-senior-management/SitePages/Home.aspx" target="_blank">ASML Senior Management Intranet page</a>)

shead.#text:
This section shows the personal targets for the employee. Targets should be SMART ( Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant and Time-bound). New targets can be added by clicking on "Add new target". The personal targets are proposed by the employee and set by the direct manager.
<br />
<br />
The Target weight needs to be defined by adding a percentage to all variable pay personal targets, the sum of which needs to be 100%.
<br />
<br />
During the Mid-Year and End-Year review, employees and managers are requested to give input about the progress and achievements per target.
shead.@description:
This section shows the personal targets for the employee. Targets should be SMART ( Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant and Time-bound). New targets can be added by clicking on "Add new target". The personal targets are proposed by the employee and set by the direct manager.

The Target weight needs to be defined by adding a percentage to all variable pay personal targets, the sum of which needs to be 100%.

During the Mid-Year and End-Year review, employees and managers are requested to give input about the progress and achievements per target.

yglui_str_doc_col_def.@fieldlabel: Mid-year review (employee) ALWAYS VISIBLE TO MANAGER
Mid-year review (manager) ALWAYS VISIBLE TO EMPLOYEE
Mid-year review (employee) ALWAYS VISIBLE TO MANAGER
Mid-year review (manager) ALWAYS VISIBLE TO EMPLOYEE

shead.#text:
This section shows the cascaded team targets. These targets are applicable for the employee and are defined by the manager.
<br />
<br />
During the Mid-Year and End-Year review, employees and managers are requested to give input about the progress and achievements per target.
shead.@description:
This section shows the cascaded team targets. These targets are applicable for the employee and are defined by the manager.
<br />
<br />
During the Mid-Year and End-Year review, employees and managers are requested to give input about the progress and achievements per target.

shead.#text:
The Variable Pay guideline is set in the ASML Senior and Executive Management Performance related Variable Pay plan.
<br />
<br />
The supervisory board will assess the Corporate results against the Corporate targets set.
<br />
<br />
The direct manager will asses the individual performance against personal targets set.
shead.@description:
The Variable Pay guideline is set in the ASML Senior and Executive Management Performance related Variable Pay plan.
<br />
<br />
The supervisory board will assess the Corporate results against the Corporate targets set.
<br />
<br />
The direct manager will asses the individual performance against personal targets set.

shead.#text: In this section, the key areas of responsibility within the current position of the employee need to be described. This gives you the opportunity to describe the fundamentals of the position and can help to define and specify your personal targets.
shead.@description: In this section, the key areas of responsibility within the current position of the employee need to be described. This gives you the opportunity to describe the fundamentals of the position and can help to define and specify your personal targets.

shead.#text:
In the following sections additional targets can be set for the employee on an individual and team basis.
<br />
<br />
These targets are not part of the Variable Pay plan, but can be useful in setting further direction.
<br />
<br />
Target priority needs to be defined by adding a percentage to all non-variable pay targets (both individual targets and team targets), the sum of which needs to be 100%.
<br />
<br />
These targets, in combination with the Variable Pay targets will be assessed in the overall performance review and basis for the PPM rating in the 9- box grid on the Results/ What-axis.

shead.#text:
This section shows the ASML Values that need to be demonstrated by the employee in their position, with other words "how we work at ASML".
<br />
The ASML Values in the areas of People, Product and Process are the basis for an integrated assessment on demonstrated behaviours of the employee (for more information about the ASML Values go to the <a href="https://my.asml.com/sectors/es/hro/hrworld/Documents/ASML%20PPM%20Competency%20Framework.pdf" target="_blank">ASML Competency Framework </a>).
<br />
During the Mid-Year and End-Year review, employees and managers are requested to give input about the progress on demonstrated behaviour (HOW).
<br />
<br />
<br />
<b><u>People - I take charge and cooperate</u></b>
<br />
<i>Teamwork:</i>
<br />
I communicate effectively and cooperate in a constructive and empathetic manner with all stakeholders
<br />
<br />
<i>Leadership:</i>
<br />
I align my self and others and take charge (incl. also personal and professional leadership)
<br />
<br />
<b><u>Product - I commit to win</u></b>
<br />
<i>Goal Orientation:</i>
<br />
I achieve agreed goals in an effective and efficient way
<br />
<br />
<i>Ownership:</i>
<br />
I take ownership and show responsibility
<br />
<br />
<b><u>Process - I do continuously improve</u></b>
<br />
<i>Improvement Focus:</i>
<br />
I do analyze processes and situations and generate improvement ideas in a complex working environment
<br />
<br />
<i>Quality Focus:</i>
<br />
I do structure & prioritize my work and deliver high quality

ehead.@description:
Indicate the performance on the HOW by assessing the demonstrated behavior of the employee in the areas of People, Product and Process throughout the year.

During the end-year review the manager will enter the final score in the "OVERALL PPM SCORE" section.

yglui_str_doc_col_def.@fieldlabel: Mid-year review (employee) ALWAYS VISIBLE TO MANAGER
Mid-year review (manager) ALWAYS VISIBLE TO EMPLOYEE

shead.#text: This section shows  the overall PPM score of an employee as input for 12+ merit. The manager needs to define the overall scores on the Result area (WHAT) based on the individual scores per target. The score for the ASML Values area (HOW) is based on the integral assessment of the demonstrated behaviours related to the ASML Values. The overall PPM rating will be displayed in the 9-box grid.
shead.@description: This section shows  the overall PPM score of an employee as input for 12+ merit. The manager needs to define the overall scores on the Result area (WHAT) based on the individual scores per target. The score for the ASML Values area (HOW) is based on the integral assessment of the demonstrated behaviours related to the ASML Values. The overall PPM rating will be displayed in the 9-box grid.

shead.#text:
The promotion input indicates if the employee will be eligible for a salary-grade promotion for the next salary round. You can give input to explain your motivation. To process the salary-grade promotion the manager has to go to the salary planning module (HR4U) to complete the detailed promotion information.

This section of the PPM form is only visible to the manager, it is not visible to the employee.

Please note the information of promotion input will be made available to the employee on request.
shead.@description:
The promotion input indicates if the employee will be eligible for a salary-grade promotion for the next salary round. You can give input to explain your motivation. To process the salary-grade promotion the manager has to go to the salary planning module (HR4U) to complete the detailed promotion information.

This section of the PPM form is only visible to the manager, it is not visible to the employee.

Please note the information of promotion input will be made available to the employee on request.

shead.#text:
This section shows the overall comments of the employee and the manager about the current performance year.

During the employee acknowledgement step in the PPM process, the employee needs to indicate the level of satisfaction with the PPM process and a motivation of the level of satisfaction. The employee defines this based on the complete process (Target Setting, DAP, MYR and EYR) as well as the quality, the frequency and timing of the dialogues with the manager.

By pressing the "Acknowledged and complete process" button the employee states the PPM form has been shared and discussed. Sign off does not necessarily mean that the employee agrees with the outcome.
shead.@description:
This section shows the overall comments of the employee and the manager about the current performance year.

During the employee acknowledgement step in the PPM process, the employee needs to indicate the level of satisfaction with the PPM process and a motivation of the level of satisfaction. The employee defines this based on the complete process (Target Setting, DAP, MYR and EYR) as well as the quality, the frequency and timing of the dialogues with the manager.

By pressing the "Acknowledged and complete process" button the employee states the PPM form has been shared and discussed. Sign off does not necessarily mean that the employee agrees with the outcome.

shead.#text:
The Part Appraisal input will be requested by the manager. The Part Appraiser has the opportunity to look at the targets of an employee and give an overall input in the text box "Part Appraisal" below.

This section of the PPM form is only visible to the manager, it is not visible to the employee.

Please note the information of part appraisal will be made available to the employee on request.
